title: 289 - Robert Yates: Serial Killing "Family Man"
description:
Robert Lee Yates often described himself as a "family man." And he was a family man. He was a married father of five. Married to the mother of his children for over twenty years. He was also a decorated veteran who served in the military for over twenty years as well, most of that span in active duty service as a helicopter pilot of the army. He was, for many, the last person you would suspect to be a sexually motivated serial killer. But that's who he also was. Yates killed at least a dozen women in  1997 and 1998, most of them in Spokane, Washington, not far from the campus of Gonzaga University, where I was a student at that time. While I was studying and partying, less than a mile away, women were getting picked up, paid for sex, and then shot in the head by a wolf in sheep's clothing. Who is Robert Lee Yates, and why did he do what he did? We try and find out in this week's true crime edition of Timesuck.

itunes:summary: Between 1975 and 1998, Spokane serial killer Robert Lee Yates killed at least sixteen people. Fifteen women and one man. Outside of his initial two victims, the rest were female sex workers. And the overwhelming majority of his victims died in 1997 and 1998. What possessed this married father of five to lead such a dark secret life? We try and find out this week.
